div.p: The type of laboratory service used in producing a laboratory result

publisher.value: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative

description.value: The type of laboratory service used in producing a laboratory result

display.value: Laboratory concerned with cultures, to look for suspected pathogens.

definition.value: Laboratory concerned with cultures, to look for suspected pathogens.

display.value: Laboratory responsible for examining parasites, feces samples may be examined for evidence of intestinal parasites such as tapeworms or hookworms and others.

definition.value: Laboratory responsible for examining parasites, feces samples may be examined for evidence of intestinal parasites such as tapeworms or hookworms and others.

display.value: Laboratory concerned with identification of viruses in specimens such as blood, urine, and cerebrospinal fluid.

definition.value: Laboratory concerned with identification of viruses in specimens such as blood, urine, and cerebrospinal fluid.

display.value: Laboratory that works with whole blood to do full blood counts, and blood films as well as many other specialised tests.

definition.value: Laboratory that works with whole blood to do full blood counts, and blood films as well as many other specialised tests.

display.value: Laboratory that usually receives serum or plasma and tests the serum for chemicals present in blood.

definition.value: Laboratory that usually receives serum or plasma and tests the serum for chemicals present in blood.

display.value: Laboratory that mainly tests for pharmaceutical and recreational drugs. Urine and blood samples are submitted to this lab.

definition.value: Laboratory that mainly tests for pharmaceutical and recreational drugs. Urine and blood samples are submitted to this lab.

display.value: Immunology/Serology laboratory uses the concept of antigen-antibody interaction as a diagnostic tool. Compatibility of transplanted organs is also determined.

definition.value: Immunology/Serology laboratory uses the concept of antigen-antibody interaction as a diagnostic tool. Compatibility of transplanted organs is also determined.

display.value: Laboratory or blood bank that determines blood groups, and performs compatibility testing on donor blood and recipients. It also prepares blood components, derivatives, and products for transfusion.

definition.value: Laboratory or blood bank that determines blood groups, and performs compatibility testing on donor blood and recipients. It also prepares blood components, derivatives, and products for transfusion.

display.value: Laboratory tests urine for many analytes. Some health care providers have a urinalysis laboratory, while others don't.

definition.value: Laboratory tests urine for many analytes. Some health care providers have a urinalysis laboratory, while others don't.

display.value: Surgical, cytopathology, or histopathology laboratory. Surgical pathology examines organs, limbs, tumors, fetuses, and other tissues biopsied in surgery such as breast mastectomies.

definition.value: Surgical, cytopathology, or histopathology laboratory. Surgical pathology examines organs, limbs, tumors, fetuses, and other tissues biopsied in surgery such as breast mastectomies.

display.value: Laboratory that mainly performs DNA analysis.

definition.value: Laboratory that mainly performs DNA analysis.

display.value: Laboratory that uses blood and other cells to get a karyotype. This can be helpful in prenatal diagnosis (e.g. Down's syndrome) as well as in cancer (some cancers have abnormal chromosomes).

definition.value: Laboratory that uses blood and other cells to get a karyotype. This can be helpful in prenatal diagnosis (e.g. Down's syndrome) as well as in cancer (some cancers have abnormal chromosomes).
